page.title: 17Sandford, Housing.
page.content: Bovis Homes are brick and mortar.They are traditional built meaning there is not a timber frame.They do not build timber frame houses as they are new and have not proved anything.The dry built houses have been given bad publicity.They catch fire easily. The traditional homes have proved more than these new dry built homes.The dry built homes are not more expensive, than the traditional built homes nor are they cheaper.One advantage in a dry built home is the heating system as it is further advanced it is also cheaper to heat than traditional homes.The people that tend to buy the the houses are middle aged buisness people.The average price is to be approximately Â£70,000.The garden space is roughly a 100 square metres.
